title: Calories in a Teaspoon of Olive Oil
meta_description: Discover calories in olive oil teaspoon, including full nutrition breakdown, fat content, and tips for healthy use in cooking or dressings.
h1: Calories in a Teaspoon of Olive Oil
assumptions: Extra virgin olive oil, 1 level teaspoon (approximately 5 ml or 4.5 g).
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by olive oil type (extra virgin, virgin, refined), brand, and density; always check labels for precise values.

quick_answer.text: One teaspoon of olive oil provides about 40 calories, primarily from monounsaturated fats.

label_note: Values align with Nutrition Facts labels for straightforward comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp balsamic vinegar for dressing
Use light olive oil instead of extra virgin

faqs.q: How many calories in one teaspoon of olive oil?
What is the fat content in a teaspoon of olive oil?
faqs.a: About 4.5 g total fat, including 0.6 g saturated fat.

faqs.q: How do calories differ between olive oil types?
faqs.a: Extra virgin and refined are similar at ~40 kcal/tsp; light versions may be slightly lower.

faqs.q: Is a teaspoon of olive oil healthy?
faqs.a: Yes, due to heart-healthy monounsaturated fats, but use in moderation as it's calorie-dense.
